definitions: To fall down or in suddenly; to cave in.
To break down completely; to fail suddenly and utterly.
To fold or be folded compactly.
To lose all strength or health and fall down.
To cause to fall down or in suddenly.
examples: The old building began to collapse.
His business might collapse under the pressure.
The chairs collapse for easy storage.
She felt herself collapse from exhaustion.
The engineers had to collapse the structure.
You can collapse the tent in minutes.
